name: Bruno's Car
description: A parked Buick automobile containing the mysteriously deceased Bruno. The vehicle is left unattended on Crescent Street B, becoming a grim and silent crime scene tied to multiple ongoing investigations in Cassandra.

snapshot.name: Bruno's Car (12.26)
snapshot.location: Crescent Street B, parked in front of a two-story wooden house
snapshot.description: A Buick car is parked quietly along Crescent Street B. Inside, Bruno’s body is slumped in the driver’s seat with the seatbelt still fastened. His corpse appears unnaturally desiccated, resembling a dried mummy rather than a recently deceased man. The scene is eerily still, with no signs of a conventional struggle or accident.

characters.name: Bruno Galilei
characters.notes: Body severely dehydrated; cause and time of death cannot be determined by normal means. Neck bears two circular bite wounds approximately 1 cm in diameter.

clues.clueText: Bruno’s body shows extreme dehydration with no clear time of death
reveals: Death involved unnatural or non-human factors

clues.clueText: Two circular bite marks on Bruno’s neck
reveals: Bruno was attacked rather than dying of natural causes

clues.clueText: Mobile phone in Bruno’s hand with an unfinished draft message containing only a name: 'Lucifero'
reveals: Bruno was trying to identify or warn someone about Lucifero

clues.clueText: Case files and physical evidence from the Reindeer Bar murder (THE SECOND CASE, December 22, 2003) placed on the front passenger seat. Also contains references to the FIRST CASE (December 22, 2002) at Paradil Grand Hotel.
reveals: Bruno was actively investigating BOTH cases before his death
Bruno believed the two cases were connected despite being exactly one year apart
The first case (19-year-old, frozen in ice) and second case (21-year-old, gunshot/stab) are distinct but related

conditions.description: Natural street lighting depending on time of day

events: Investigators discover Bruno’s body inside the parked vehicle
Police personnel claim Bruno never returned to the station after leaving

exits.description: Leads back onto the residential street

snapshot.keeperNotes: Bruno was investigating BOTH MURDER CASES: FIRST CASE (December 22, 2002)—19-year-old Black girl, frozen in ice at Paradil Grand Hotel. SECOND CASE (December 22, 2003)—21-year-old Black girl (Lucifero), gunshot and knife at Reindeer Bar. Exactly one year apart, TWO DIFFERENT BODIES, different methods. The unnatural state of Bruno's body should immediately unsettle investigators. Police NPCs will deny knowledge of Bruno returning to the station, increasing suspicion and isolation.

connections.description: The car is parked directly on Crescent Street B
Evidence in the car ties Bruno’s death to the Reindeer Bar murder case
Police deny Bruno returned there, creating an inconsistency investigators can pursue
